title: Account for type param in `'_` constraint for returned trait suggestion

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
[Given](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=33c3cc5f64a996c1475c86c57bc4edfd)

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f7a1f97307e2f878297c6096f3afcc6fc2a31f22/src/test/ui/issues/issue-16922.rs#L1-L6

we currently output

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f7a1f97307e2f878297c6096f3afcc6fc2a31f22/src/test/ui/issues/issue-16922.stderr#L1-L12

The suggestion is incomplete and will not result in compilable code. Because the lifetime is coming from an argument of type `T`, which is an unconstrained type parameter, `T` itself will _not_ have the needed lifetime and causes the `'static` obligation that we're trying to reverse by suggesting `'_`. The appropriate changes to the code would be either `fn foo<'a, T: Any + 'a>(value: &'a T) -> Box<dyn Any + 'a>` or `fn foo(value: &dyn Any) -> Box<dyn Any + '_>`, depending on whether `T` appears in any other argument or not.
